HttpException.name: HttpException
description: This class gives you a way to throw HTTP errors semantically.
This class extends `Error`.

A property to hold the HTTP response code associated with this
exception.
code.name: code

constructor.name: constructor
description: Construct an object of this class.

code.name: code
description: The HTTP response code associated with this exception.

message.name: message
description: (optional) The exception message.

HttpMiddlewareException.name: HttpMiddlewareException
description:
This class gives you a way to throw HTTP errors semantically in the
middleware classes. The difference between this class and `HttpException`
comes when you want to check which exception was thrown via
`exception.constructor.name`.
This class extends `Error`.

A property to hold the HTTP response code associated with this
exception.
code.name: code

constructor.name: constructor
description: Construct an object of this class.

code.name: code
description: The HTTP response code associated with this exception.

message.name: message
description: (optional) The exception message.

Middleware.name: Middleware
description: This is the base middleware class for all middleware classes.
A property to hold the location that this middleware should process.
location.name: location

description:
A property to hold the name of this middleware class. This property is
used by `Drash.Http.Server` to help it store middleware in the correct
`middleware_*` property.
name.name: name

description: A property to hold the request object.
request.name: request

description:
A property to hold the resource object. This property will only contain
the resource object if this middleware is a resource-level middleware.
resource.name: resource

description:
A property to hold the response object. This property will only contain
the response object if the server was able to get a response from the
resource.
response.name: response

description: A property to hold the server object handling this middleware.
server.name: server

constructor.name: constructor

request.name: request
description: The request object.

server.name: server
description: The server object handling this middleware.

resource.name: resource
description:
(optional) If this is a resource-level middleware, then it will have
access to the resource that uses it.

constructor.signature: constructor(request: any, server: Drash.Http.Server, resource?: Drash.Http.Resource, response?: Drash.Http.Response)

Resource.name: Resource
description:
This is the base resource class for all resources. All resource classes
must be derived from this class.
A property to hold the middleware this resource uses.

All derived middleware classes MUST define this property as `static`
(e.g., `static middleware = ["MiddlewareClass"];`)
middleware.name: middleware

description:
A property to hold the name of this resource. This property is used by
`Drash.Http.Server` to help it store resources in its `resources`
property by name.
name.name: name

description: A property to hold the paths to access this resource.

All derived resource classes MUST define this property as `static`
(e.g., `static paths = ["path"];`)
paths.name: paths

description: The request object.
request.name: request

description: The response object.
response.name: response

description: The server object.
server.name: server

Response.name: Response
description: Response handles sending a response to the client making the request.
A property to hold the body of this response.
body.name: body

description: A property to hold this response's headers.
headers.name: headers

description: The request object.
request.name: request

description:
A property to hold this response's status code (e.g., 200 for OK).
This class uses `Status` and `STATUS_TEXT` from the Deno Standard
Modules' http_status module for response codes.
status_code.name: status_code

constructor.name: constructor
description: Construct an object of this class.

generateResponse.name: generateResponse
description: Generate a response.

getStatusMessage.name: getStatusMessage
description: Get the status message based on the status code.

Returns the status message associated with `this.status_code`. For
example, if the response's `status_code` is `200`, then this method
will return "OK" as the status message.

getStatusMessageFull.name: getStatusMessageFull
description:
Get the full status message based on the status code. This is just the
status code and the status message together (e.g., `200 (OK)`, `401
(Unauthorized)`, etc.).

send.name: send
description: Send the response to the client making the request.

Returns the output which is passed to `request.respond()`. The output
is only returned for unit testing purposes. It is not intended to be
used elsewhere as this call is the last call in the
request-resource-response lifecycle.

sendStatic.name: sendStatic
description:
Send the response of a static asset (e.g., a CSS file, JS file, PDF
file, etc.) to the client making the request.

file.name: file
description: The file that will be served to the client.

sendStatic.signature: public sendStatic(file: string):status: number, headers: Headers, body: any {

Server.name: Server
description:
Server handles the entire request-resource-response lifecycle. It is in
charge of handling HTTP requests to resources, static paths, sending
appropriate responses, and handling any errors that bubble up within the
request-resource-response lifecycle.

A property to hold the Deno server. This property is set in
`this.run()` like so: ` this.deno_server =
serve(this.configs.address);`. `serve()` is imported from
[https://deno.land/x/http/server.ts](https://deno.land/x/http/server.ts).
deno_server.name: deno_server

description: A property to hold this server's logger.
logger.name: logger

description: A property to hold this server's configs.
configs.name: configs

description:
A property to hold the location of this server on the filesystem. This
property is used when resolving static paths.
directory.name: directory

description: A property to hold the resources passed in from the configs.
resources.name: resources

description:
This server's list of static paths. HTTP requests to a static path are
usually intended to retrieve some type of concrete resource (e.g., a
CSS file or a JS file). If an HTTP request is matched to a static path
and the resource the HTTP request is trying to get is found, then
`Drash.Http.Response` will use its `sendStatic()` method to send the
static asset back to the client.
static_paths.name: static_paths

constructor.name: constructor
description: Construct an object of this class.

configs.name: configs
description: `address`: `string`
`logger`: `Drash.Loggers.ConsoleLogger|Drash.Loggers.FileLogger`
`response_output`: `string` (a proper MIME type)
`resources`: `Drash.Http.Resource[]`
`static_paths`: `string[]`

getRequest.name: getRequest
description: Get the request object with more properties and methods.

request.name: request
description: The request object.

Returns any "request" object with more properties and methods that
Drash uses. For example, deno uses the `ServerRequest` object; and this
method takes that object and hydrates it with more properties and
methods.

handleHttpRequest.name: handleHttpRequest
description: Handle an HTTP request from the Deno server.

request.name: request
description: The request object.
See `Drash.Http.Response.send()`.

handleHttpRequestError.name: handleHttpRequestError
description: Handle cases when an error is thrown when handling an HTTP request.

request.name: request
description: The request object.

error.name: error
description: The error object.
See `Drash.Http.Response.send()`.

handleHttpRequestError.signature: public handleHttpRequestError(request: any, error: any, resource: Drash.Http.Resource = null, response: Drash.Http.Response = null): any

handleHttpRequestForFavicon.name: handleHttpRequestForFavicon
description:
Handle HTTP requests for the favicon. This method only exists to
short-circuit favicon requests--preventing the requests from clogging
the logs.

Returns the response as stringified JSON. This is only used for unit
testing purposes.

handleHttpRequestForStaticPathAsset.name: handleHttpRequestForStaticPathAsset
description: Handle HTTP requests for static path assets.

Returns the response as stringified JSON. This is only used for unit
testing purposes.

getResourceObject.name: getResourceObject

description:
Returns an instance of the resourceClass passed in, and setting the
`paths` and `middleware` properties

getResourceObject.signature: public getResourceObject(resourceClass: any, request: any): Resource

run.name: run
description:
Run the Deno server at the address specified in the configs. This
method takes each HTTP request and creates a new and more workable
request object and passes it to
`Drash.Http.Server.handleHttpRequest()`.

This method just listens for requests at the address you provide in the
configs.

close.name: close
description: Close the server.

addHttpResource.name: addHttpResource
description:
Add an HTTP resource to the server which can be retrieved at specific
URIs.

Drash defines an HTTP resource according to the MDN Web docs
[here](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/Identifying_resources_on_the_Web).

resourceClass.name: resourceClass
description: A child object of the `Drash.Http.Resource` class.

This method just adds `resourceClass` to `this.resources` so it can be
used (if matched) during an HTTP request.

addMiddleware.name: addMiddleware
description: Add server-level and resource-level middleware.

addStaticPath.name: addStaticPath
description:
Add a static path for serving static assets like CSS files, JS files,
PDF files, etc.

This method just adds `path` to `this.static_paths` so it can be used (if
matched) during an HTTP request.

executeMiddlewareResourceLevelBeforeRequ.name: executeMiddlewareResourceLevelBeforeRequest
description: Execute resource-level middleware before the request.

request.name: request
description: The request object.

resource.name: resource
description: The resource object.

executeMiddlewareServerLevelBeforeReques.name: executeMiddlewareServerLevelBeforeRequest
description: Execute server-level middleware before the request.

request.name: request
description: The request object.

resource.name: resource
description: The resource object.

getResourceClass.name: getResourceClass
description: Get the resource class.

request.name: request
description: The request object.

Returns a `Drash.Http.Resource` object if the URL path of the request
can be matched to a `Drash.Http.Resource` object's paths.
Returns `undefined` if a `Drash.Http.Resource` object can't be matched.

requestTargetsStaticPath.name: requestTargetsStaticPath
description: Is the request targeting a static path?
Returns true if the request targets a static path.

logDebug.name: logDebug
description: Log a debug message

message.name: message
description: Message to log

LoggerConfigs.name: LoggerConfigs
description:
`enabled`: Is the logger enabled? This is useful if you have a config
file that can toggle this option between `true` and `false`.
`level`: Options are `all`, `trace`, `debug`, `info`, `warn`, `error`, `fatal`, and `off`.
`tag_string`: This only takes a string with tags as `{tag}`. For example, `{some_tag} | {some_tag} * {some_tag} [{some_tag}]`.

`tag_string_fns`: This takes an object of key-value pairs where the key is the name of the tag defined in the `tag_string` config. This object is used to replace tags in the `tag_string` config by matching keys to tags and replacing tags with the values of the keys. For example, if `tag_string` was `{my_cool_tag}` and `tags_string_fns.my_cool_tag` returns `"HELLO"`, then `{my_cool_tag}` would be replaced with `HELLO`.

ConsoleLogger.name: ConsoleLogger
description: This logger allows you to log messages to the console.

constructor.name: constructor
description: Construct an object of this class.

configs.name: configs
description: See `Drash.CoreLoggers.Logger.configs`.

write.name: write
description: Write a log message to the console.

This method is not intended to be called directly. It is already used
in the base class (`Logger`) and automatically called.
Returns the log message which is used for unit testing purposes.

write.signature: public write(logMethodLevelDefinition: any, message: string): string|void

FileLogger.name: FileLogger
description: This logger allows you to log messages to a file.
The file this logger will write log messages to.
file.name: file

constructor.name: constructor
description: Construct an object of this class.

configs.name: configs
description: See `Drash.CoreLoggers.Logger.configs`.

write.name: write
description: Write a log message to `this.file`.

This method is not intended to be called directly. It is already used
in the base class (`Logger`) and automatically called.
Returns the log message which is used for unit testing purposes.

Logger.name: Logger
description: This Logger is the base logger class for all logger classes.
This logger's configs. See [LoggerConfigs](/#/api-reference/interfaces/logger-configs).
configs.name: configs

description: The level of the log message currently being written.
current_log_message_level_name.name: current_log_message_level_name

constructor.name: constructor
description: Construct an object of this class.

configs.name: configs
description: See [Drash.CoreLoggers.Logger.configs](/#/api-reference/loggers/logger#configs).

debug.name: debug
description: Output a DEBUG level log message.

message.name: message
description: The log message.

error.name: error
description: Output an ERROR level log message.

message.name: message
description: The log message.

fatal.name: fatal
description: Output a FATAL level log message.

message.name: message
description: The log message.

info.name: info
description: Output an INFO level log message.

message.name: message
description: The log message.

trace.name: trace
description: Output a TRACE level log message.

message.name: message
description: The log message.

warn.name: warn
description: Output a WARN level log message.

message.name: message
description: The log message.

getTagStringParsed.name: getTagStringParsed
description: Get the parsed version of the raw tag string.

sendToWriteMethod.name: sendToWriteMethod
description:
Send the message to the write method (which should be in the child
class).  Also, do some prechecks before sending to see if the log
message should be written.

logMethodLevelDefinition.name: logMethodLevelDefinition
description: The dictionary definition of the log message's level.

message.name: message
description: The log message.
Returns the log message which is used for unit testing purposes.

HttpService.name: HttpService
description: This class helps perform HTTP-related processes.

getMimeType.name: getMimeType
description: Get a MIME type for a file based on its extension.

filePath.name: filePath
description: The file path in question.

fileIsUrl.name: fileIsUrl
description: (optional) Is the file path  a URL to a file? Defaults to false.

If the file path is a URL, then this method will make sure the URL
query string is not included while doing a lookup of the file's
extension.

Returns the name of the MIME type based on the extension of the
file path .

getMimeType.signature: public getMimeType(filePath: string, fileIsUrl: boolean = false): string

HttpRequestService.name: HttpRequestService
description: This class helps perform HTTP request related processes.

getRequestBodyFile.name: getRequestBodyFile
description:
Parse this request's body as `multipart/form-data` and get the
requested input.

file.name: file
description: The file to get by its name.

maxMemory.name: maxMemory
description: The max memory to allocate for this process. Defaults to 1MB.

Returns a body as a parsable JSON object where the first level of keys
are the names of the parts. For example, if the name of the first part
is `file_number_one`, then it will be accessible in the returned object
as `{returned_object}.file_number_one`.

getRequestBodyFile.signature: public getRequestBodyFile(parsedBody: ParsedBody, input: string): any

getRequestBodyParam.name: getRequestBodyParam
description:
Get the value of one of this request's body params by its input name.
First, check the Content-Type of the request so that we know how to
parse the body. Then parse the body accordingly and retrieve the
requested value.
getRequestBodyParam.signature: public getRequestBodyParam(parsedBody: ParsedBody, input: string): any

getRequestHeaderParam.name: getRequestHeaderParam
description: Get the value of one of this request's headers by its input name.
getRequestHeaderParam.signature: public getRequestHeaderParam(request: any, input: string): string

getRequestPathParam.name: getRequestPathParam
description: Get the value of one of this request's path params by its input name.
getRequestPathParam.signature: public getRequestPathParam(request: any, input: string): string

getRequestUrlQueryParam.name: getRequestUrlQueryParam
description: Get the value of one of this request's query params by its input name.
getRequestUrlQueryParam.signature: public getRequestUrlQueryParam(request: any, input: string): string

getResponseContentType.name: getResponseContentType
description: Get the request's requested content type.

There are three ways to get this value: (1) the request's headers by
setting `Response-Content-Type: "type"`, (2) the request's URL query
params by setting `?response_content_type=type`, and the request's body
by setting `{response_content_type: "type"}`.
The request's body takes precedence over all other settings.

The request's URL query params takes precedence over the header setting
and the default setting.
The request's header setting takes precedence over the default setting.

If no content type is specified by the request's body, URL query
params, or header, then the default content type will be used. The
default content type is the content type defined in the
`Drash.Http.Server` object's `response_output` config. If a default is
not specified, then "application/json" will be used.
getResponseContentType.signature: public getResponseContentType(request: any, defaultContentType: string = "application/json"): void

getUrlPath.name: getUrlPath
description: Get this request's URL path.
Returns the URL path.

getUrlQueryParams.name: getUrlQueryParams
description: Get the request's URL query params by parsing its URL query string.

request.name: request
description: The request object.
Returns the URL query string in key-value pair format.

getUrlQueryString.name: getUrlQueryString
description: Get the specified HTTP request's URL query string.

Returns the URL query string (e.g., key1=value1&key2=value2) without
the leading "?" character.

hasBody.name: hasBody
description: Does the specified request have a body?
Returns `true` if the request has a body. Returns `false` if not.

hydrate.name: hydrate
description: Hydrate the specified request object.

Returns a hydrated request object. For example, deno uses the
`ServerRequest` object. This method takes that object and adds more
porperties and methods to it. This makes it easier for Drash to process
the object for its own purposes.

hydrate.signature: public async hydrate(request: any, options?: OptionsConfig): Promise<boolean>

parseBody.name: parseBody
description: Parse the specified request's body.

Returns the content type of the body, and based on this
the body itself in that format. If there is no body, it
returns an empty properties

parseBody.signature: public async parseBody(request: any, options: OptionsConfig): Promise<ParsedBody>

parseBodyAsFormUrlEncoded.name: parseBodyAsFormUrlEncoded
description: Parse this request's body as application/x-www-form-url-encoded.

Returns an empty object if no body exists, else a key/value pair
array e.g. returnValue['someKey']

parseBodyAsJson.name: parseBodyAsJson
description: Parse this request's body as application/json.
JSON object - the decoded request body

parseBodyAsMultipartFormData.name: parseBodyAsMultipartFormData
description: Parse this request's body as multipart/form-data.

body.name: body
description: The request's body.

boundary.name: boundary
description: The boundary of the part (e.g., `----------437192313`)

maxMemory.name: maxMemory
description: The maximum memory to allocate to this process in megabytes.

Returned values can be seen here (look for `readForm`:
https://deno.land/std@v0.32.0/mime/multipart.ts

parseBodyAsMultipartFormData.signature: public async parseBodyAsMultipartFormData(body: Reader, boundary: string, maxMemory: number): Promise< [key: string]: string | FormFile > {

setHeaders.name: setHeaders
description: Set headers on the request.
setHeaders.signature: public setHeaders(request: any, headers: Headers): void

ObjectParser.name: ObjectParser
description: A util class to help parse objects.

getNestedPropertyValue.name: getNestedPropertyValue
description: Get the value of a deeply nested property.

inputObject.name: inputObject
description: The object containing the deeply nested property.

properties.name: properties
description:
The rest of the arguments as strings to use as property names when
finding the nested property's value. The last argument that the rest
parameter finds is the nested property you are targeting.
Returns the value of the targeted property.

ColorizeOptions.name: ColorizeOptions
description: An interface to hold the `colorize()` function's options.

colorize.name: colorize
description: A util function that helps colorize text in the console.

message.name: message
description: The text to colorize.

options.name: options
description: See `Drash.Utils.Exports.ColorizeOptions` interface.
Returns the colorized message.

colorize.signature: export function colorize(message: string, options: ColorizeOptions): string

getFileSystemStructure.name: getFileSystemStructure
description: Get the filesystem structure of the directory (recursively).

Returns the following object:
{
basename: "filename",
extension: extension, // does not account for .min.extension or similar extensions
filename: filename.extension,
path: "/path/to/the/file/dir/filename.extension",
pathname: "/path/to/the/file/dir",
snake_cased: filename_extension
}
